attributes.action: Insist on certain Sporting Events to be on Free-To-Air Channels
attributes.additional_details: Like so many, having heard how Formula One has had been part sold to Sky, I felt it was time the Government looked at making certain events Free-To-Air. The actual Sky deal though is quite clever and I think to myself, if PPV TV can buy F1 Sporting Rights then 'share' it with a Free-To-Air Channel, then why not do it with others? May I suggest at least One England Test Per Series be Broadcast Live on Free-To-Air, at least 20 Premiership Football Matches and 20 Championship/Division One/Division Two Matches per season, One Guiness Premiership (Rugby Union) Game a week (and all European Challenge Cup Games) and one Super League (Rugby League) Game a week. It's not too much to ask is it?
